Now in my opinion uh memory is probably
the biggest issues that is faced by
mobile developers because compared to
other platforms mobile has a lot of
additional challenges. So for example
unlike PC we have no virtual memory uh
or rather we have virtual memory but no
swap file uh which is or swap file on
the flash storage which means if we have
to ask for more memory uh we will not
get more memory. we'll end up with the
out of memory exception and our game
will crash. Uh and similarly uh we can
have data uh which is which can be
stored directly in memory which is which
we call memory map but there is no swap
to large swap file on the storage which
means our game will once again crash.
And on Android, we do have this uh this
really cool feature called ZRAMM or
ZRAMM uh which allows you to compress
your memory that's being used by apps in
the foreground. But if that compress if
but if you still run out of memory
because there's like a background
application or forgo or another
application that's asking for more RAM,
you will again crash. And similarly on
consoles there is or unlike consoles
there's no fixed amount of memory
available because the amount of memory
varies by device by the OS versions and
on Android also your background
processes can also take up memory and
might cause uh problems. So why am I
telling all of these things? This is
because there's so much going on memory
that memory analysis tools or on mobile
become very very important.
So which is why we have memory insights
uh which is a brand new tool uh which
has been available since 5.4 for Android
and 5.5 with for iOS. Now this is a very
cool uh tool because uh in Unreal Engine
we are able to tag all the memory
allocations using an LLM tag and so
let's say you're loading a brand new
level from a previous level. So in the
previous level all the allocations that
has been made uh has to be deallocated
when you're loading the new level. But
if the deallocations don't happen the
you can this tool will then highlight
and flash all of those memories that has
not been uh deallocated and are meant to
